summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions on Iraq, reaffirms Iraq's independence, sovereignty, unity, and territorial integrity.

Supports Iraq in post-conflict reconstruction and reconciliation, meeting the needs of all Iraqis.

Decides to extend the mandate of UNAMI until 31 May 2019.

The Special Representative of the Secretary-General and UNAMI shall:

- Advise, support, and assist the Government and people of Iraq on inclusive political dialogue and national and community-level reconciliation.

- Support elections and referenda, constitutional review, and implementation of constitutional provisions.

- Facilitate regional dialogue and cooperation on border security, energy, environment, water, and refugees.

- Support security sector reform, reintegration programmes for former members of armed groups.

- Promote, support, and facilitate humanitarian assistance, safe return of refugees and displaced persons.

- Coordinate and implement programmes to improve Iraq's civil, social, and essential services.

- Support economic reform, capacity-building, and sustainable development.

- Promote accountability, protection of human rights, judicial and legal reform.

- Ensure the participation, involvement, and representation of women.

- Assist child protection, including rehabilitation and reintegration of children.

Recognizes the essential security of UN personnel and calls upon the Government of Iraq to provide security and logistical support.

Intends to review UNAMI's mandate by 31 May 2019.

Welcomes the independent external assessment of UNAMI and encourages implementation of recommendations.

Requests the Secretary-General to report to the Council every three months on UNAMI's progress.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
